summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) requesting urgent approval for an AUSA to travel to the U.K. to interview a victim/witness in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The witness was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and would only speak in person, necessitating the trip to preserve her testimony for trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case for which the victim/witness is being interviewed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the perpetrator of the abuse against the victim/witness being interviewed.

connections.description: Maxwell is the defendant in a case where the witness was a victim of Epstein, implying their alleged association in criminal activity.
The document states the witness was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
The witness is being interviewed for the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, suggesting the witness is also a victim or witness to Maxwell's alleged actions.

events.title: AUSA Travel to U.K. for Witness Interview
events.description: Planned travel by an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) to the United Kingdom to conduct an in-person interview with a victim/witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The SDNY urgently requested approval in October 2020 for an AUSA to travel to the U.K. to interview a victim/witness.
The witness was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and would only provide a statement in person.
The interview was deemed necessary to preserve the government's right to use the witness's testimony at the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document highlights the ongoing international investigative efforts in the Maxwell case years after Epstein's death.
The correspondence shows coordination between the SDNY and the Executive Office for U.S. Attorneys (EOUSA) for travel approval.
